source: LSU Fact Book 2025 • LSU Athletics Media Guide • LSU Center for Computation & Technology

highlights.title: Flagship on the Mississippi
highlights.body: LSU's 1,000-acre Baton Rouge campus sits along the Mississippi River, lined with 1,200 live oaks planted in the 1930s.

highlights.title: R1 Research Power
highlights.body: Only public Tier 1 (R1) institution in Louisiana with $409M in annual R&D spending and 300+ active labs.

highlights.title: AI & High Performance
highlights.body: The LSU Center for Computation & Technology and Stephenson Department of Entrepreneurship & Information Systems run the state's largest GPU cluster and launched an AI & Data Analytics minor in 2025.

highlights.title: SEC Heritage
highlights.body: LSU joined the Southeastern Conference in 1933; Tiger Stadium ("Death Valley") seats 102,321 and has recorded decibel levels above 130 dB.

faqs.question: What does LSU stand for?
faqs.answer: Louisiana State University and Agricultural & Mechanical College.

faqs.question: When was LSU founded?
faqs.answer: LSU traces its founding to 1853 and became the state's land-grant university after the 1874 Morrill Act designation.

faqs.question: Does LSU offer AI degrees?
faqs.answer: Yes. LSU offers an AI & Data Analytics minor (launched 2025), an applied AI concentration in Computer Engineering, and graduate certificates through the Center for Computation & Technology.

faqs.question: How successful is LSU football?
faqs.answer: LSU football claims national titles in 1958, 2003, 2007, and 2019; 51 team national championships across all sports and 100+ individual NCAA champs.

faqs.question: Does LSU have a live tiger?
faqs.answer: Yes. Mike the Tiger VII lives in a $3 million habitat beside Tiger Stadium; the habitat includes a waterfall, stream, and climate control.

people.title: Ruffin G. Pleasant
people.body: Quarterbacked and captained LSU's first regularly organized varsity teams in 1895–1896 before becoming Louisiana's 36th governor.

people.title: Shaquille O'Neal
people.body: Consensus NCAA basketball player of the year in 1991; part of LSU's lineage of pro athletes spanning the NBA, NFL, WNBA, and MLB.

people.title: Seimone Augustus
people.body: LSU women's basketball legend, four-time WNBA champion, Olympic gold medalist, and member of the 2024 Naismith Hall of Fame class.

places.title: Patrick F. Taylor Hall
places.body: Home to the College of Engineering; located along South Stadium Drive at Nicholson Extension with skybridges to the PFT Annex.

places.title: Middleton Library
places.body: Main library on the Quad; open 24/5 during fall and spring with makerspace access on Level 2.

places.title: Mike the Tiger Habitat
places.body: 15,000 sq ft enclosure between Tiger Stadium and the PMAC; visitors can see Mike daily from sunrise to sunset.

traditions.title: Callin' Baton Rouge
traditions.body: Country singer Garth Brooks' anthem plays before every fourth quarter in Tiger Stadium.

traditions.title: The Golden Band
traditions.body: The Golden Band from Tigerland forms the LSU on-field logo before kickoff and leads the "Hold That Tiger" cadence.

stats.ranking_ai: Top Gulf South public AI talent pipeline

events.title: Bayou AI Summit
events.details: CCT convenes researchers on AI for energy, coast, and resilience initiatives at Patrick F. Taylor Hall.

events.title: LSU vs. Alabama (Baseball)
events.details: Alex Box Stadium hosts SEC rivals; Friday night fireworks highlight the series.
